title: Wayland schools investigating after Black student targeted in racist locker room incident
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Wayland High School investigates a racist incident involving a Black student's jersey on a plastic figure in a locker room.
School officials and police identified responsible students, coordinating with the DA and Anti-Defamation League for community support.
Wayland has a history of racial incidents, including one involving ex-superintendent Omar Easy and a 2022 basketball game.

title: Kevin Durant, Rockets pummel exhausted Celtics to snap three-game winning streak: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics lost 128-101 to the Houston Rockets, ending their three-game winning streak.
Kevin Durant scored 26 points for the Rockets, who capitalized on the Celtics' exhaustion and schedule challenges.
Baylor Scheierman led the Celtics with 17 points, while Derrick White and Payton Pritchard continued their shooting slumps.

title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevate D'Ernest Johnson to 53-man roster with Rhamondre Stevenson out due to a toe injury.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, previously played for the Browns, Jaguars, and Cardinals.
With Antonio Gibson also injured, TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings will join Johnson in Sunday's game against the Falcons.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov have formed a new defensive pairing, improving the Bruins' performance in recent games.
The Bruins have tightened their defensive play, allowing just one high-danger chance against Carolina in a 2-1 win.
Hampus Lindholm's return and Jonathan Aspirot's steady play have further strengthened the Bruins' defensive unit.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed only one goal in his return to the net, securing a 2-1 victory against the Carolina Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm rotated goalies, with Swayman returning after Joonas Korpisalo's consecutive starts following a 7-2 loss to Ottawa.
Despite recent adjustments, Swayman maintains higher statistics over Korpisalo, including a better save percentage and goals saved above expected.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox enter the offseason with $218.92 million in salary, $25 million below luxury tax threshold.
Star third baseman Alex Bregman expected to opt out of his contract, becoming a free agent.
Chief Baseball Officer Craig Breslow identifies starting rotation, first and second base as key upgrade areas.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will call his third New England Patriots game this season, showcasing his familiarity with their progress.
The Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have achieved a 6-2 record, surprising many with their performance.
McCourty noted Maye's impressive development, highlighting key plays that showcased his improved skill set as a quarterback.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots are reportedly targeting Dolphins' Jaelan Phillips before Tuesday's NFL trade deadline, per The Athletic's Dianna Russini.
The Dolphins, who are 2-7 this season, are seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips.
Phillips has recorded three sacks this season and ranks 11th in pressures among NFL edge rushers.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei is benched for the third consecutive game against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm suggests Lohrei should be angry about his exclusion from the lineup.
Lohrei's defense struggles contrasted by improved play after Hampus Lindholm's return and Nikita Zadorov's pairing with Charlie McAvoy.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Falcons enter Sunday's game with a 3-4 record; Bijan Robinson leads NFL in scrimmage yards per game with 137.4.
Michael Penix struggles in outdoor environments, losing all three starts with 53.1% completion rate and 65.5 passer rating.
Falcons' defense ranks second in yards allowed; A.J. Terrell leads a strong secondary, limiting opposing QBs to 162.7 yards per game.
